result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Jonah H Voltz in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  
Defendant states he is eligible for a public defender and requests more time. 
Court will set a new status date.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Walmart/Waukesha Public Library in the City of Waukesha listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:34 AM Defendant Jonah H Voltz in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court requests the Public Defender Intern add the defendant to their list to be evaluated.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court sets a quick further proceedings date before the Trial Court so the defendant may be evaluated and potentially set this matter for resolution.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
